subject: Nutrition
title: Eating More Vegetables
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Eating More Vegetables.

hook.text: If there's one nutrition tip nearly every scientist agrees on, it's this: eat more vegetables.

buildup.text: Vegetables provide fiber, vitamins, minerals, and phytonutrients with very few calories.

discovery.text: Each daily serving of vegetables reduces all-cause mortality risk by about 5%, up to five servings.

twist.text: Despite decades of public health campaigns, only 10% of Americans eat the recommended amount.

climax.text: Frozen vegetables are just as nutritious as fresh ones and cost far less. No excuses left.

punchline.text: The simplest health advice is still the most ignored.

quiz.question: What percentage of Americans eat enough vegetables?
